title: HMSHost’s Airport Restaurant Month is Back with Seasonal Fall Flavors
text:
HMSHost’s Airport Restaurant Month is Back with Seasonal Fall Flavors Anchorage airport to participate 
Nearly 60 airport restaurants to participate in innovative culinary event for travelers 

BETHESDA, MD —Crisp smells of autumn will soon be in the air as HMSHost ’s Airport Restaurant Month returns this October with seasonal fall menus in nearly 60 restaurants in North American airports, including Ted Stevens Anchorage International Airport in Anchorage, Alaska. 

Airport Restaurant Month celebrates the same gastronomical experiences and plating displays diners experience at popular neighborhood restaurants during the familiar phenomenon known as restaurant week. The only differences are the venue and the duration—in an airport and for a full month. 

“This October marks the first anniversary of the debut of Airport Restaurant Month and we are thrilled to be offering travelers this month-long culinary event again with seasonally-themed menus,” said HMSHost Vice President of Marketing Atousa Ghoreichi. 

HMSHost’s executive chef and culinary team have created special menus for Airport Restaurant Month inspired by the essence and aromas of fall. 

Featured for the whole month of October, this seasonal fall menu showcases rich flavors and dishes such as pan roasted Wild Alaska salmon from Copper River Seafoods served at the Anchorage International Airport with maple mustard; grilled chicken breast with fall mushroom ragout; and Berkshire pork tenderloin with caramelized apples, pan jus. 

Appetizers and side dishes complement each meal, and wine pairings are recommended to add the perfect touch to round out the combination of flavors. Guests can select their choice entrée, accompanied by several side dishes. 

Restaurants at numerous airports will be participating. Look for Airport Restaurant Month at: 

Ted Stevens Anchorage International Airport (Anchorage, Alaska)
